title: (x) BLAST magazine/Citibank - Simple/(customized) OCRK {David H/Justin}
content:
anyone know what face this is?   
 ![face image](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42476.jpg)   
   
also, what is the face that citibank uses?   
   
thanks people!
author: jondj24

comments.content: I don't recognize that sample, but as far as Citibank you're probably looking for [OCRK](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/testpilot/ocrk/), or possibly [Interstate](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate/).

Should be pretty, hmm, simple.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
' [Simple](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.norm.to/pages/simple.html)', by [Norm](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.norm.to/) / [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.lineto.com/)..   
 [www.lineto.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.lineto.com/) / [www.norm.to](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.norm.to/)

Justins right, about OCRK.: CitiBank uses a custom version of ' [OCRK Bold Square](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.testpilotcollective.com/paypal/ocrk.html)' by [Joe Kral](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.joekral.org/) / [Test Pilot Collective](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.testpilotcollective.com/).. _( As revealed by the fabulous Typophile archives + Google.: [www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/230.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052528/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/230.html) )_
